content.description: Sit start the slopey arête and move left to top out.
content.location: This ascends the arête to the left of the problem Impact Statement.

content.description: Sit start, matched in the angled crack move up to a pinch and a crimp and then move out left to the lip and top out.
content.location: Walk about 5-6 minutes past the small boulderfield on the Tarr Trail, and this boulder will be on your right.

content.description: Stand start with a good left edge and the right on the arete.
content.location: It is on the biggest boulder in the small boulderfield. Start in a small alcove about 5 feet left of the problem Googen.

content.description: Sit start off the rock using a high, left hand, two finger crimp and a low, right hand smear/crimp. Move straight up on slopers, pinches, and crimps to an easy topout.
content.location: Start about 4-5 feet right of the problem Googen.

content.description: ,Sit start the face that faces away from the trail. Start with a cool, downward pointing triangular sloper and move up to match on the crimp bar. Move right hand to a shallow dish and then make a long move to a good positive bucket side pull. Make another move or two and top out.
content.location: It is roughly in the middle of the small boulderfield.

content.description: Sit start as for the problem Impact Statement Right, but once you get the crimp bar, move left with difficulty up the steep slab to a distant micro-crimp bar, and top out.
content.location: Use the same start as Impact Statement Right.

content.description: This is a low sit start on the left-leaning arete. Start with your left hand on small, flat crimp and your right hand really low on a rounded, sloper pinch. Move your right hand to a pinch on arete, and then move left with difficulty to top out. The grade is for the low start, as starting higher would be easier.
content.location: This ascends the steep arête/lip on the biggest boulder at the far end of the small boulderfield.
This is on the backside of the biggest boulder in the small boulderfield. Start a foot or two left of a tree.

content.description: Sit start on low crimps with only a high left foot chip for feet. Make a hard pull off the ground and then several more crimpy moves through the seam and slap left hand to a shallow dish and topout.
content.location: Sit start just left of a tree and about 4-5 feet left of the problem Clam Shell.

content.description: Sit start with a good hidden right foot in the corner and really low hands, move into the double pinch, and top it out.
content.location: This ascends the obvious, steep arete with the double pinch feature midway.

content.description: Stand start the right arete matched on a huge granite pinch.
content.location: Recently found, this is near the small Tarr Trail boulderfield.

content.description: Sit start on the rock about 10 feet left of the problem Double Pinch, and move left on good holds.
content.location: This is off to the left about 5 minutes past the small boulderfield on the Tarr Trail. There is a big detached flake that looks like a giant clamshell a few few back from the start of this problem.

content.description: This is a small boulderfield with some problems.
